SILVER - Individual Market Analysis

CoT signals and diagnostics for Silver futures.

As of 2025-11-25

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • Silver futures positioning is currently balanced, with speculative net long interest at 13.19% and hedgers net short at 16.74% as of 2025-11-25.
  • The signal indicates a transition from recent speculative short extremes and a shift by hedgers from a deeply long bias to a neutral stance.
  • Current readings are moderate, with no participants in 1-year extreme positioning territory.

Key Dynamics:

  • Speculative net positioning `Spec_Net_%OI` stands at 13.19%, while hedger net positioning `Hedger_Net_%OI` is -16.74% [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html].
  • The 4-week flow `Flow_4w` shows marginal long reduction (-0.66%), stabilizing after earlier reductions but lacking strong directional momentum [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html].
  • Hedgers' z-score `Hedger_zscore` has moved to 0.89 (neutral) from previous extreme long positions, while speculators maintain a moderate short bias at -1.43 `Spec_zscore` [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html].

Macro Relevance:

  • This signal informs commodity market supply/demand dynamics, specifically for silver, and reflects underlying sentiment and positioning risk.
  • CoT signals are generally tactical, informing mid-cycle flow and late-cycle exhaustion risks within specific commodity markets.
  • It typically interacts with signals related to industrial production, inflation expectations, and broad risk sentiment at the aggregate level.

Data & References:

  • Silver CoT Signals, as of 2025-11-25 [Source: Silver_CoT_Signals.html].
  • `Spec_Net_%OI`, `Hedger_Net_%OI`, `Spec_zscore`, `Hedger_zscore`, and `Flow_4w` were the most influential data points.
  • Industrial Production data [Source: industrial_production_signal] and Global Trade Demand indicators [Source: global_trade_demand_group] would improve signal depth.

Self-Healing

  • High-Value Inputs to Add:
    • Definition of z-score thresholds for "extreme" for both speculators and hedgers: This would provide explicit quantitative context for "extreme" classifications.
    • Historical price data for silver: Allows for direct visual back-testing of positioning signals against price action.
  • Weaknesses in Provided Inputs:
    • No explicit thresholds for `Hedger_Deep_Long` or `Hedger_Neutral` flags: Provide the z-score ranges or percentile definitions that trigger these regime flags.
